Interface Module<M,R>

Type Parameters:
M - the type of module elements (vectors)
R - the type of ring elements (scalars)
All Superinterfaces:
AbelianGroup<M>, AbelianMonoid<M>, Group<M>, Magma<M>, Monoid<M>, Set<M>
All Known Subinterfaces:
Algebra<E,F>, BanachSpace<E,S>, HilbertSpace<E,S>, LieAlgebra<E,S>, Matrix<E>, NonAssociativeAlgebra<E,S>, Vector<E>, VectorSpace<V,F>
All Known Implementing Classes:
CudaMatrix, DenseMatrix, DenseVector, MatrixLieAlgebra, SparseMatrix, Vector3D, VectorSpace2D, VectorSpace3D
public interface Module<M,R> extends AbelianGroup<M>
A module is a generalization of a vector space over a ring instead of a field.

Mathematical Definition

A left R-module M consists of:

  • An abelian group (M, +)
  • A ring R
  • A scalar multiplication R × M → M satisfying:
    • r(x + y) = rx + ry
    • (r + s)x = rx + sx
    • (rs)x = r(sx)
    • 1x = x (if R has unity)

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)
